laboratory_examinations.findings: The liver is heterogeneous in signal characteristics with a 10 x 10 mm focus in segment 2, likely a small cyst or biliary hamartoma. There is cholelithiasis and mild pericholecystic free fluid with no gallbladder wall edema. There is a 13 mm calculus in the cystic duct and the cystic duct is dilated measuring up to 15 mm. The pancreatic parenchyma is normal with scattered 1 to 3 mm cysts likely representing a side-branch IPMN. The kidneys and other abdominal structures are normal.
